Basic Convex Shape Optimization

This tutorial demonstrates how to optimize a convex shape using a learned convex diffeomorphism.

We assume basic familiarity with PyTorch.

Problem setup

We want to learn a convex domain Ω by optimizing a gauge-based diffeomorphism.

Code

 1"""An example file for the numerical approximation 
 2of the isoperimetric inequality
 3"""
 4
 5import torch
 6import shutil
 7import os
 8
 9from shapes.invertible_nn import ConvexDiffeo
10from shapes.plot_utils import plot_shape
11
12# Parameters
13DIM = 3
14N_QUAD = 100_000
15OUTPUT_FOLDER = 'res/isoperimetric'
16
17# Select device
18device = torch.device('cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu')
19print(f'Using device : {device}')
20
21# Create the output foler
22shutil.rmtree(OUTPUT_FOLDER, ignore_errors=True)
23os.makedirs(OUTPUT_FOLDER, exist_ok=True)
24
25# Create the model
26model = ConvexDiffeo(input_size=DIM, n_unit=20).to(device)
27
28# Set up optimizer
29optimizer = torch.optim.LBFGS(model.parameters(), lr=.002)
30
31# For the l-bfgs optimizer
32def closure():
33    optimizer.zero_grad()
34
35    per = model.perimeter(n_points=N_QUAD)
36    vol = model.volume(n_points=N_QUAD)
37    loss = per/vol**((DIM-1)/DIM)
38
39    loss.backward()
40
41    return loss
42
43# Optimize
44for step in range(1_000):
45    plot_shape(model, output=os.path.join(OUTPUT_FOLDER, f'{step}.png'))
46    loss = optimizer.step(closure)
47    print(f'Loss = {loss.item()}')

Adding symmetries

 1"""An example file for the numerical approximation 
 2of the isoperimetric inequality for convex bodies
 3with the symmetries of the equilateral triangle.
 4"""
 5
 6import torch
 7import shutil
 8import os
 9from math import sqrt
10
11from shapes.invertible_nn import ConvexDiffeo
12from shapes.plot_utils import plot_shape
13
14# Parameters
15DIM = 2
16N_QUAD = 100_000
17OUTPUT_FOLDER = 'res/isoperimetric_symmetries'
18
19
20# Define the symmetries
21def id(x):
22    return x
23
24
25def rot_1(x):
26    x_cpy = x.clone()            # make a copy
27    x_cpy[:, 0] = -0.5*x[:, 0] - sqrt(3)/2*x[:,1]
28    x_cpy[:, 1] = sqrt(3)/2*x[:, 0] - 0.5*x[:,1]
29    return x_cpy
30
31def rot_2(x):
32    x_cpy = x.clone()            # make a copy
33    x_cpy[:, 0] = -0.5*x[:, 0] + sqrt(3)/2*x[:,1]
34    x_cpy[:, 1] = -sqrt(3)/2*x[:, 0] - 0.5*x[:,1]
35    return x_cpy
36
37symmetries = [id, rot_1, rot_2]
38
39
40# Select device
41device = torch.device('cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu')
42print(f'Using device : {device}')
43
44# Create the output foler
45shutil.rmtree(OUTPUT_FOLDER, ignore_errors=True)
46os.makedirs(OUTPUT_FOLDER, exist_ok=True)
47
48# Create the model and pass the symmetries
49model = ConvexDiffeo(input_size=DIM, n_unit=20, symmetries=symmetries).to(device)
50
51# Set up optimizer
52optimizer = torch.optim.LBFGS(model.parameters(), lr=.02)
53
54# For the l-bfgs optimizer
55def closure():
56    optimizer.zero_grad()
57
58    per = model.perimeter(n_points=N_QUAD)
59    vol = model.volume(n_points=N_QUAD)
60    loss = per/vol**((DIM-1)/DIM)
61
62    loss.backward()
63
64    return loss
65
66# Optimize
67for step in range(1_000):
68    plot_shape(model, output=os.path.join(OUTPUT_FOLDER, f'{step}.png'))
69    loss = optimizer.step(closure)
70    print(f'Loss = {loss.item()}')
